title: Rule
text: In the case of a qualified individual, there shall be allowed as a credit against the tax imposed by this chapter for the taxable year an amount equal to 15 percent of such individual's section 22 amount for such taxable year.

logical_structure.result: In the case of a qualified individual, there shall be allowed as a credit against the tax imposed by this chapter for the taxable year an amount equal to 15 percent of such individual's section 22 amount for such taxable year.

raw_text:
I.R.C. § 22(a)General Rule—In  the case of a qualified individual, there shall be allowed as a credit  against
                  the tax imposed by this chapter for the taxable year an amount  equal to 15 percent
                  of such individual's section 22 amount for such  taxable year.

title: Individual
text: For purposes of this section, the term “qualified individual" means any individual——who has attained age 65 before the close of the taxable year, or—who retired on disability before the close of the taxable year and who, when he retired, was permanently and totally disabled.
conditions: he retired, was permanently and totally disabled.

if: he retired, was permanently and totally disabled.
logical_structure.result: For purposes of this section, the term “qualified individual" means any individual——who has attained age 65 before the close of the taxable year, or—who retired on disability before the close of the taxable year and who,

I.R.C. § 22(b)Qualified Individual—For  purposes of this section, the term “qualified individual"
                  means any  individual—I.R.C. § 22(b)(1)—who  has attained age 65 before the close of the taxable year, orI.R.C. § 22(b)(2)—who  retired on disability before the close of the taxable year and who, when  he
                     retired, was permanently and totally disabled.

requirements: any individual——who has attained age 65 before the close of the taxable year, or—who retired on disability before the close of the taxable year and who, when he retired, was permanently and totally disabled.

title: General
text: An individual's section 22 amount for the taxable year shall be the applicable initial amount determined under paragraph(2), reduced as provided in paragraph(3)and in subsection(d).

logical_structure.result: An individual's section 22 amount for the taxable year shall be the applicable initial amount determined under paragraph(2), reduced as provided in paragraph(3)and in subsection(d).

I.R.C. § 22(c)(1)In General—An  individual's section 22 amount for the taxable year shall be the  applicable initial
                     amount determined under paragraph(2), reduced as  provided in paragraph(3)and in subsection(d).

conditions: only one spouse is a qualified individual,

title: General
text: In the case of a qualified individual who has not attained age 65 before the close of the taxable year, except as provided in clause(ii), the initial amount shall not exceed the disability income for the taxable year.

except: as provided in clause(ii), the initial amount shall not exceed the disability income for the taxable year.
logical_structure.result: In the case of a qualified individual who has not attained age 65 before the close of the taxable year,

raw_text:
I.R.C. § 22(c)(2)(B)(i)In General—In  the case of a qualified individual who has not attained age 65 before the  close
                           of the taxable year, except as provided in clause(ii), the initial  amount shall not exceed the disability income for the taxable year.

title: Rules In Case Of Joint Return
text: In the case of a joint return where both spouses are qualified individuals and at least one spouse has not attained age 65 before the close of the taxable year——if both spouses have not attained age 65 before the close of the taxable year, the initial amount shall not exceed the sum of such spouses' disability income, or—if one spouse has attained age 65 before the close of the taxable year, the initial amount shall not exceed the sum of $5,000 plus the disability income for the taxable year of the spouse who has not attained age 65 before the close of the taxable year.
conditions: both spouses are qualified individuals and at least one spouse has not attained age 65 before the close of the taxable year——
both spouses have not attained age 65 before the close of the taxable year, the initial amount shall not exceed the sum of such spouses' disability income, or—

one spouse has attained age 65 before the close of the taxable year, the initial amount shall not exceed the sum of $5,000 plus the disability income for the taxable year of the spouse who has not attained age 65 before the close of the taxable year.

if: both spouses are qualified individuals and at least one spouse has not attained age 65 before the close of the taxable year——
both spouses have not attained age 65 before the close of the taxable year, the initial amount shall not exceed the sum of such spouses' disability income, or—

one spouse has attained age 65 before the close of the taxable year, the initial amount shall not exceed the sum of $5,000 plus the disability income for the taxable year of the spouse who has not attained age 65 before the close of the taxable year.
logical_structure.result: In the case of a joint return

raw_text:
I.R.C. § 22(c)(2)(B)(ii)Special Rules In Case Of Joint Return—In  the case of a joint return where both spouses are qualified individuals  and at
                           least one spouse has not attained age 65 before the close of the  taxable year—I.R.C. § 22(c)(2)(B)(ii)(I)—if  both spouses have not attained age 65 before the close of the taxable  year, the
                              initial amount shall not exceed the sum of such spouses'  disability income, orI.R.C. § 22(c)(2)(B)(ii)(II)—if  one spouse has attained age 65 before the close of the taxable year, the  initial
                              amount shall not exceed the sum of $5,000 plus the disability  income for the taxable
                              year of the spouse who has not attained age 65  before the close of the taxable year.

title: Income
text: For purposes of this subparagraph, the term “disability income” means the aggregate amount includable in the gross income of the individual for the taxable year under section72or105(a)to the extent such amount constitutes wages (or payments in lieu of wages) for the period during which the individual is absent from work on account of permanent and total disability.

logical_structure.result: For purposes of this subparagraph, the term “disability income” means the aggregate amount includable in the gross income of the individual for the taxable year under section72or105(a)to the extent such amount constitutes wages (or payments in lieu of wages) for the period during which the individual is absent from work on account of permanent and total disability.

title: General
text: The reduction under this paragraph is an amount equal to the sum of the amounts received by the individual (or, in the case of a joint return, by either spouse) as a pension or annuity or as a disability benefit——which is excluded from gross income and payable under——title II of the Social Security Act,—the Railroad Retirement Act of 1974, or—a law administered by the Department of Veterans Affairs, or—which is excluded from gross income under any provision of law not contained in this title.No reduction shall be made under clause(i)(III)for any amount described in section104(a)(4).

logical_structure.result: The reduction under this paragraph is an amount equal to the sum of the amounts received by the individual (or, in the case of a joint return, by either spouse) as a pension or annuity or as a disability benefit——which is excluded from gross income and payable under——title II of the Social Security Act,—the Railroad Retirement Act of 1974, or—a law administered by the Department of Veterans Affairs, or—which is excluded from gross income under any provision of law not contained in this title.No reduction shall be made under clause(i)(III)for any amount described in section104(a)(4).

raw_text:
I.R.C. § 22(c)(3)(A)In General—The  reduction under this paragraph is an amount equal to the sum of the  amounts
                        received by the individual (or, in the case of a joint return, by  either spouse)
                        as a pension or annuity or as a disability benefit—I.R.C. § 22(c)(3)(A)(i)—which  is excluded from gross income and payable under—I.R.C. § 22(c)(3)(A)(i)(I)—title  II of the Social Security Act,I.R.C. § 22(c)(3)(A)(i)(II)—the  Railroad Retirement Act of 1974, orI.R.C. § 22(c)(3)(A)(i)(III)—a  law administered by the Department of Veterans Affairs, orI.R.C. § 22(c)(3)(A)(ii)—which  is excluded from gross income under any provision of law not contained in 
                           this title.No reduction shall be made under clause(i)(III)for any
                           amount described in section104(a)(4).

title: Of Certain Workmen's Compensation Benefits
text: For purposes of subparagraph(A), any amount treated as a social security benefit under section86(d)(3)shall be treated as a disability benefit received under title II of the Social Security Act.

logical_structure.result: For purposes of subparagraph(A), any amount treated as a social security benefit under section86(d)(3)shall be treated as a disability benefit received under title II of the Social Security Act.

                        Act.

title: Couple Must File Joint Return
text: Except in the case of a husband and wife who live apart at all times during the taxable year, if the taxpayer is married at the close of the taxable year, the credit provided by this section shall be allowed only if the taxpayer and his spouse file a joint return for the taxable year.
conditions: the taxpayer is married at the close of the taxable year, the credit provided by this section shall be allowed only
the taxpayer and his spouse file a joint return for the taxable year.

if: the taxpayer is married at the close of the taxable year, the credit provided by this section shall be allowed only
the taxpayer and his spouse file a joint return for the taxable year.
except: in the case of a husband and wife who live apart at all times during the taxable year,

raw_text:
I.R.C. § 22(e)(1)Married Couple Must File Joint Return—Except  in the case of a husband and wife who live apart at all times during the 
                     taxable year, if the taxpayer is married at the close of the taxable year,  the credit
                     provided by this section shall be allowed only if the taxpayer  and his spouse file
                     a joint return for the taxable year.

title: Status
text: Marital status shall be determined under section7703.

logical_structure.result: Marital status shall be determined under section7703.

raw_text: I.R.C. § 22(e)(2)Marital Status—Marital  status shall be determined under section7703.

title: And Total Disability Defined
text: And Total Disability Defined—An individual is permanently and totally disabled if he is unable to engage in any substantial gainful activity by reason of any medically determinable physical or mental impairment which can be expected to result in death or which has lasted or can be expected to last for a continuous period of not less than 12 months. An individual shall not be considered to be permanently and totally disabled unless he furnishes proof of the existence thereof in such form and manner, and at such times, as the Secretary may require.

An individual shall not be considered to be permanently and totally disabled
he furnishes proof of the existence thereof in such form and manner, and at such times, as the Secretary may require.

An individual shall not be considered to be permanently and totally disabled

raw_text:
I.R.C. § 22(e)(3)Permanent And Total Disability Defined—An  individual is permanently and totally disabled if he is unable to engage  in any
                     substantial gainful activity by reason of any medically  determinable physical or
                     mental impairment which can be expected to result  in death or which has lasted or
                     can be expected to last for a continuous  period of not less than 12 months. An individual
                     shall not be considered  to be permanently and totally disabled unless he furnishes
                     proof of the  existence thereof in such form and manner, and at such times, as the
                     Secretary may require.

title: Alien Ineligible For Credit
text: No credit shall be allowed under this section to any nonresident alien.

logical_structure.result: No credit shall be allowed under this section to any nonresident alien.

raw_text: I.R.C. § 22(f)Nonresident Alien Ineligible For Credit—No  credit shall be allowed under this section to any nonresident alien.
